thread.title: LSU receiver commitment Da'Monte Coxie picks up Florida offer
thread.title_full: LSU receiver commitment Da'Monte Coxie picks up Florida offer | NOLA.com

author: Julie Boudwin, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: LSU receiver commitment Da'Monte Coxie picks up Florida offer
text:
LSU commitment and East St. John senior wide receiver Da'Monte Coxie committed to the Tigers in July. On Tuesday, he picked up his first offer since pledging to the Tigers.
"Florida offered me today," Coxie told NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune.
Even though Coxie is committed to LSU, he hopes the offers continue to pour in.
"I hope to get offers from many schools. It's always good to have a open mind," the receiver said. "LSU is my dream school, but it's good to keep your options open."
The 6-foot-3, 185-pound standout was in Baton Rouge over the weekend to watch LSU's 35-28 victory over Florida.
"The game was exciting. It was really packed and everyone knew it was going to be a good game," he described the atmosphere in Tiger Stadium.
And Coxie is liking what he's seeing from the LSU offense behind Leonard Fournette and Brandon Harris.
"The offense is nice. Brandon has a strong arm and does a good job and Leonard runs over everyone in his way. I love it."
Here's LSU WR commitment Da'Monte Coxie ( @Only_1_Montay ) with a diving 27 yard TD catch! #nolaprep pic.twitter.com/Y3eOdbh5aY
